conclusion: The position of a shadow depends on the relative positions of the object and the light source. When the light source moves, the shadows will shift in the opposite direction.

The size of a shadow can change depending on the angle of the light source relative to the object. If the light source moves closer to being directly behind the object, the shadow will generally become larger because the light rays will be more spread out.
